name: Aqua

faqs.a: Aqua is a non‑custodial mobile wallet supporting Bitcoin, Lightning and Liquid in one interface for easy saving and spending.
No. Aqua is a self‑custodial wallet and does not require KYC to use the app.
Yes. Aqua is open‑source and welcomes community review and contributions.

WW.text: Privacy benefits with confidential transactions on Liquid
Built-in swap between on-chain and Liquid
Relies on Boltz for Lightning swaps

description:
Aqua Wallet, originally launched by Blockstream, later taken over by Jan3, is a mobile app designed for easy saving and spending in Bitcoin. It's a non-custodial, open-source wallet using a 12-word seed phrase for user control, and a unified balance across on-chain Bitcoin, Lightning, and Liquid Network transactions, defaulting to Liquid for low-fee, private payments. It offers sending, receiving, and swapping Bitcoin (on-chain to Liquid or vice versa) but for Lightning payments they rely on Boltz, a third party which can occur higher swap fees. This might affect daily usability for some users.

The app has an intuitive interface - although the design could use some work - and offers seamless swaps between on-chain Bitcoin and Lightning or Liquid.

JAN3's mission is to onboard billions to Bitcoin, with a vision to expand Aqua with debit card integration, credit/loans, and global on/off-ramps. Beginners love its simple setup and versatility, but some find stablecoin options and swap fees confusing.
compat_heading: What this Aqua wallet can or can't do

compat_tiles.title: Pay with Lightning
compat_tiles.benefit: Via Boltz Higher swap fees

compat_tiles.title: Pay on-chain
compat_tiles.benefit: Bitcoin Liquid Built-in swaps

compat_tiles.title: Receive on Lightning
compat_tiles.benefit: Via Boltz Swaps to Liquid or Bitcoin

compat_tiles.title: Receive on-chain
compat_tiles.benefit: Bitcoin Liquid Unified interface

compat_explainers.why: Aqua routes Lightning payments through Boltz swaps, enabling Lightning without native channels.
try: Scan or paste a Lightning invoice
Review the swap fee (typically higher than native Lightning wallets)
Confirm and Aqua swaps from Liquid/on-chain to Lightning
compat_explainers.gotcha: Aqua relies on Boltz for Lightning, which can have higher fees than wallets with native Lightning channels. Best for occasional Lightning use.

compat_explainers.why: Aqua supports both Bitcoin and Liquid networks with seamless swaps between them.
try: Paste a Bitcoin or Liquid address
Aqua auto-detects the network and routes appropriately
Review fee and confirm—Liquid is faster and cheaper
compat_explainers.gotcha: Bitcoin on-chain fees vary with network congestion. Liquid transactions are faster with lower fees but require Liquid-compatible wallets.

compat_explainers.why: Receive Lightning payments that Aqua swaps to your Liquid or Bitcoin balance.
try: Generate a Lightning invoice in Aqua
Aqua receives via Boltz and settles to Liquid or Bitcoin
compat_explainers.gotcha: Boltz swap fees apply. For frequent Lightning receives, consider a wallet with native Lightning channels like Phoenix or Breez.

compat_explainers.why: Receive both Bitcoin and Liquid in one unified interface with built-in privacy on Liquid.
try: Tap Receive and select Bitcoin or Liquid
Share the address with the sender
Funds appear after confirmations—Liquid is faster (1-2 min)
compat_explainers.gotcha: Liquid transactions offer confidential amounts but require both sender and receiver to use Liquid-compatible wallets.
